Group.Name: Excess
Group.Trivia:
Not to be mixed up with the UK based group <group id=2273> which was active 1989-1990.
In 1994 Excess did three first releases in cooperation with <group id=485>. Excess was in co-op with <group id=91> from 1995 to 1996 and very active these days. Did several releases in cooperation with <group id=145> from 1998 on. The next co-op was for a quite short time from late 1998 till April of 1999 with <group id=114> with a handful of releases.
In the '90s Excess released 25 issues of the disk magazine Nitro from December 1991 to May 1998. The first Issue was released at the <event id=505>. The further issues up to #12 were released at the Venlo meetings. In early 1994 Nitro took over the no. 1 spot from Skyhigh in the charts of many magazines for a short time, but lost it after issue #17, which had several bugs in the menu-coding. The coding was changed again one issue later, and Nitro came back to the no. 1 spot during 1995. Until the last issue Nitro was mostly a top 3 mag. After a delay of 21 years Nitro #26 was released in summer of 2019. There are no further editions planed at the moment.
We organized 4 Excess partys in Emsdetten, Germany in 1994, 1995 and 1996. The location was a pathfinder home with space for up to 50 people. The visitors had the chance to sleep in the separate sleeping room. In front of the VIP-Room the competitions were shown in the main room of the 1st floor. The biggest party was the Acrise & Excess Party in 1996 with more than 60 visitors. In January 2019 the first Excess party after 23 years took place. The Location was Hof Beel in Oberlangen, Germany. In January 2020 Excess organized a party together with Abyss Connection, again at Hof Beel.
Although Excess never was really dead, the 25th anniversary was like a rebirth. Red Rock and Sentinel became active again. With Baracuda, pcollins, Curlin, Knight Rider, Artlace and Stablizer more new members joined in 2017. In 2018 Almighty God, Harry Potthead, TheEnemy, Zirias and Finchy joined the group. In 2019 Twilight (ex-Arcade), Kickback (ex-GP), Fugu, Fulgore and Zscs became new members. Firelord returned. In 2020 B.A. and Ebster joined us and 2021 Retroluzzer, HOL2001, Sidwave and Nordischsound became new members. Beside the usual releases Excess was doing a lot of Easy Flash releases. The small mag Rapidnews was released every 2nd month from 2019 on.
Excess' budget/lamer label is <group id=2340>.

Handle.HandleStory: Uwe started beginning in Trigon, Alcoholics and after that he joined Arcade (right decision!) together with 1 Person more, called Levis/CrimeDesign/Code Demon and at least Realistic in Arcade. Uwe has been the leader of The Alcoholics and lived in Papenburg near the dutch boarder.

Scener.Trivia: - Organised the SCS+DOM - Party in Papenburg with Tyree (at that time in SCS) + Levis/CrimeDesign of The Alcohlics - loved Techno/Trance - Music - good and fast intro programmer

UserComment.Text: Another nice intro Twilight, really nice executed, and that tune!!

Handle.HandleStory: Name of the main character of the anime "SF Saiyuki Starzinger" by Leiji Matsumoto. At least here in italy, since in japanese is written Jan Kugo. I've chosen the handle "IAN" to sign my high scores on arcade games ^_^, then changed to Ian7102 in the late 80's, and finally iAN CooG from 1999 or so.

UserComment.Text: very nice and good to see the tune by GuyGavin used, instead of just upped at deepsid site
so cool. Twilight: intro coder numero uno!
